page.title: 03WORK AT WAULDBY.
page.content: On the farmland there are two cottages belonging to the farmer and two of his employees live in them. There used to be eight cottages but as machinery became more popular the need for farm employees became less. The present employees start work at about 7.30am. The Wolds Way goes through the farm. There are certain public rights of way; one for horse riders and one for people walking. There is a road leading from the farm going down to the farmer's brother's modern farm, called Little Wauldby Farm. On the farm's land they have a petrol pump which still works, a bacon house,an old coach house and a barley store.
